intro: Medusanthera andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman medusanthera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structures. The plant produces showy, multi-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
